alert.note: Alert for Fairfield; Licking (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 22 at 2:20PM EST until February 23 at 4:00PM EST by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Wilmington has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers... South Fork Licking River below I 70 near Buckeye Lake. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON THROUGH WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. This approaches the flood of record. * WHERE...South Fork Licking River below I 70 near Buckeye Lake. * WHEN...From this afternoon to Wednesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 880.0 feet, Water extends onto the 129A exit ramp from eastbound Interstate 70 to Route 79 near Buckeye Lake. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:45 PM EST Tuesday the stage was 878.0 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage late this afternoon to 880.5 feet early Wednesday morning. It will then fall below flood stage late Wednesday morning. Additional rises are then possible on Friday, but the river is currently expected to remain below flood stage on Friday. - Flood stage is 880.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Stay tuned to developments by listening to NOAA Weather Radio. For additional details on river forecasts, visit water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=iln
